misuses.misuse: CWE-321: Use of Hard-coded Cryptographic Key
misuses.description: Hard-coded cryptographic keys are a serious vulnerability because they can be easily extracted by an attacker. In this case, the hard-coded key is the initialization vector (IV) used for encryption. It should be replaced with a randomly generated IV for each encryption operation.
misuses.recommendation: Use a randomly generated IV for each encryption operation, and do not use hard-coded cryptographic keys.

description: The code contains a vulnerability related to the use of hard-coded cryptographic keys. It is a serious vulnerability because it can be easily exploited by an attacker to compromise the confidentiality and integrity of the encrypted data.
